root: ^Where is it, where is it, where is it...

dialogueAfterChoice: ^Oh, hey. Didn’t hear anyone coming, I was so lost in my thoughts.
^But now that you are here, have you seen it?
^My bone! I’m so hungry but I can’t find it anymore.
^I’m sure I hid it somewhere nearby. But I have now searched all the places I can think of, and it still remains unfound.
^I’m so forgetful, what’s wrong with me?
^There’s nothing wrong with you. You can’t remember everything.
^But your bone must be somewhere close. I can help you to look for it.
^I can look this open area here; this is where I usually bury my food. But I sometimes go a bit further into the woods, not that far though. So, if you could check the surroundings.
^I bury my food into the ground but I do leave part of it visible – just in case I forgot the exact place. You should be able to see it if you are near enough.
^Come talk to me if you find it.
